summary: This document details the execution of a search warrant at the residence of Jeffrey Epstein on July 6, 2019, in connection with a child sex trafficking investigation. Various items were collected as evidence, including photographs, letters, and personal items. The warrant was approved by Judge Barbara Moses and executed by FBI agents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the search warrant executed at his residence in connection with child sex trafficking allegations.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Judge Barbara Moses approved the search warrant that was executed at Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Steven D. Small
persons.context: Steven D. Small is mentioned as the individual who collected certain items during the search.

connections.description: Judge Barbara Moses issued the search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's residence.
Steven D. Small collected items from Epstein's residence as part of the search warrant execution.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution
events.description: A search warrant was executed at Jeffrey Epstein's residence, resulting in the collection of various items related to the investigation.

keyFacts: The search warrant was executed on July 6, 2019, at Jeffrey Epstein's residence.
Judge Barbara Moses approved the search warrant.
Items collected included photographs, letters, and various personal items.
The search was part of an investigation into child sex trafficking.
Steven D. Small was involved in the collection of evidence during the search.
